wikipedia_page.main: Alfred Clint  (1807–1883) was an English marine painter.

response: Curran painted Shelley several times. These are among the few paintings of Shelley painted in his lifetime, and the only ones of him in his adulthood which was copied by several artists including Alfred Clint and William Holl among others. They are noted for their androgynous features, and their striking similarity to Guido Reni's painting of Beatrice Cenci, which was one of the poet's favorite pictures. Curran's 1819 portrait of Shelley was included in the 1905 book Women Painters of the World and hangs at the National Portrait Gallery in London.Women Painters of the World on Project Gutenberg
*Alfred Clint (Australian painter) (1843–1923), cartoonist and theatrical scene painter
One of Clint's sons, Scipio Clint, was a notable medallist and seal engraver.  Of his other sons Raphael Clint (1797–1849) was an engraver and Alfred Clint (1807–1833) a marine painter.

He married Helena Clint (d. 1958) on 13 June 1894; they had a son and two daughters.  Helena Clint was granddaughter of Alfred Clint, President of the Society of British Artists, great-granddaughter of George Clint ARA, and great-niece of Scipio Clint.
Contemporary scene painters include Harry Holmes (who also tried his hand at theatre management). Harry Grist, Alfred Clint (son of marine painter Alfred Clint), George Gordon and Phil Goatcher.
Alfred Clint (1843 – 21 November 1923) was an Australian cartoonist and theatrical scene painter and member of a notable family of artists.
Clint was born in Kensington, England, son of marine landscapist Alfred Clint and grandson of portraitist George Clint.
**Alfred Clint (1843 – 19 November 1923) married Mary Jane Percy Lake ( – c. 10 October 1918) on 22 June 1872
